solution_line_template: If the number of dimes is 20 times the number of quarters, she has {total_dimes}/{dimes_per_quarter_ratio} = {initial_quarters} quarters.

When she puts {quarters_to_put_aside_fraction} of the quarters away, the number of quarters reduces by {quarters_to_put_aside_fraction}*{initial_quarters} = <<{quarters_to_put_aside_fraction}*{initial_quarters}={quarters_reduced_by}>>{quarters_reduced_by}
In total, she has {remaining_quarters} quarters + {total_dimes} dimes = <<{remaining_quarters}+{total_dimes}={total_combined_money}>>{total_combined_money}
